verb.description: Push (something or someone) suddenly or violently in the specified direction.
examples: she thrust her hands into her pockets
Howard was thrust into the limelight
he thrust at his opponent with his sword

noun.description: A sudden or violent lunge with a pointed weapon or a bodily part.
examples: he drove the blade upward with one powerful thrust

noun.description: The propulsive force of a jet or rocket engine.
A reverse fault of low angle, with older strata displaced horizontally over younger.

origin: Middle English (as a verb): from Old Norse thrýsta; perhaps related to Latin trudere to thrust. The noun is first recorded (early 16th century) in the sense act of pressing.
